owl:Ontology.dc:description: The main contribution of this vocabulary are five specific classes for structuring and collecting the following qualitative characteristics of scholarly papers: research objectives, research methods, research findings, future work, critique. An additional inner structure is proposed for research objectives, qualifying them as schema:StructuredValue and combining them from two lists: research action types and research artifacts. The specific classes are subclasses of schema:ItemList. In addition, the classes for research methods, research action types and research artifacts are declared as subclasses of enumeration. Thus the typical methods, activities and research artifacts of the research area can be listed in the vocabulary itself.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Scholarly Papers Vocabulary with Focus on Qualtitative Analysis
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: This vocabulary is mainly defined under the reuse of schema.org classes, relations and attributes. It is aimed at the support of research groups in the field of Business Modeling and Knowledge Engineering (BMaKE) in their collaborative work for qualitatively analyzing scholarly papers as well as sharing the results of that analyses and judgements. The vocabulary is meant to be used at first as schema for OntoWiki. Since this system doesn't process blank nodes in the intended way, the abstract nodes for specifying qualitative aspects of scholarly papers shall be modeled explicitely.
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: spv vocabulary (BMaKE)

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used in combination with research action type to indicate a research objective of a scientific paper.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: research action type

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used in combination with research action type to indicate a research objective of a scientific paper.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: research artifact

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to relate to subject matters of a creative work, mainly a scientific paper. Here mainly used to relate to blank or abstract nodes of type schema:ItemList for specifying lists of characteristics of a scientific paper, like research findings, research methods and research objectives.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: about

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate the affiliation of a person to an organization.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: affiliation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate a person attending a conference.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: attendee

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate a author of a scientific paper.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: author

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate a person contributing to a conference.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contributor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate an editor of a scientific paper or conference proceedings.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: editor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate the proceedings where a scientific paper is published.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: For itemListElement values can be used simple strings or existing entities.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: item list element

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used for different purposes to refer to a geographical place, e. g. for event locations (termporal) or for organization locations (permanent).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: location

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate a person or an organization organizing a conference.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: organizer

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to indicate a publishing organization of a scientific paper or conference proceedings.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: publisher

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is used to relate a conference to the corresponding proceedings.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: recorded in

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The page on which the scientific paper ends.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: end page

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The page on which the scientific paper starts.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: start page

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Unformalized list of critical issues observed in an analyzed scientific paper.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Critique

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Unformalized list of future work announced in an analyzed scientific paper.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Future Work

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The activity aspect of an elecited research objective taken from the list of types of research & development actions applied in Information Systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Action Type

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The artifact aspect of an elicited research objective taken from the list of all types of research & development artifacts characteristic for Information Systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Rresearch Artifact

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Unformalized list of research findings documented in an analyzed scientific paper.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Findings

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Research method applied in an analyzed scientific paper taken from a list of all relevant research methods used in Information Systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Method

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: List of formalized research methods applied in an analyzed scientific paper.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Methods

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Abstract class for modeling an elicited research objective comprising a specific research activity and a research artifact to which the activity is applied.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Objective

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: List of formalized research objectives targeted in an analyzed scientific paper.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Objectives

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Here used primarily for scientific papers, conference proceeding and related creative work.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Creative Work

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The class of Conference proceedings - regardless of the publication format.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Creative Work Series

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Encompasses basic data types for typing literals.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Type

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: General class for all literals indicating a data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Date

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: General class for all literals indicating a data and a time.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Date and Time

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Enumerations of aspects specifying a scientific paper, like research methods, research artifacts and research action types.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Enumeration

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Here used primarily for scientific conferences.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Event

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc. (taken from schema.org).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Intangible

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lists of aspects specifying a scientific paper, like research methods, research findings, research objectives, and future work.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Item List

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Natural languages such as Spanish, German, Hindi, English, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Language

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Here used for two objectives: (i) to denote the affiliations of authors and other person and (ii) to indicate publishers and conference organizers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Mainly used for identifying authors, editors, attendees, contributers, organizers and other human agents.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Here used for specifying the locations of conferences and organizations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The class of scientific conferences.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Publication Event

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The class of scientific papers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Scholarly Article

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing. Here used for specifying research objectives characterized by research actions applied to research artifacts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Structured Value

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: General class for all literals being of any textual Datatype.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Text

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: General class for all literals being an URL.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: URL

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: BUAS - Brandenburg University of Applied Sciences
THB - Technische Hochschule Brandenburg

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: examine something systematically and in detail
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: analyze

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: collect all parts or aspects of a complex object
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: collect

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: define the essential terms (concepts) and relations of a domain
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: conceptualize

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: create something according to certain design or architectural principles
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: construct

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: unambiguously describe or explain a concept
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: define

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: basically design an object, mostly according to appropriate design principles
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: design

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: create something new, mostly using specialist methods and tools
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: develop

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: capture characteristics of objects under examination (eg by measurement)
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: elicit

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: improve an object in certain features or aspects
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: enhance

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: assess a quantitative or qualitative property of an object
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: evaluate

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: extend an object by properties or in its scope of functions or services
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: extend

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: separate defined parts of a complex object and provide them in a suitable form
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: extract

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: implement a designed object technically
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: implement

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: merge several objects into a single unit
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: integrate

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: investigate how an object meets certain requirements; whether a statement (about an object) is true
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: prove

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: provide an object in a suitable manner for use
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: provide

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: systematically organize parts, aspects or the like of a complex object
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: structure

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: software artifact with a certain range of functions
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Application

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: model or technical design of an object
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Blueprint

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: set of interacting and interdependent activities that converts input to output
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Business Process

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: complex (technical) environment for the development of applications and IT systems
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Development Framework

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: technical, formal or semi-formal description of an object and the circumstances of its development or function
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Documentation

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: complex object of information technology whose parts interact and form a desing-related and functional whole
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IT System

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: a combined set of hardware, software, networks, facilities, etc. (including all of the information technology), in order to develop, test, deliver, monitor, control or support IT services
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: IT Infrastructure

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: standard-based, structured data, mostly based on the Semantic Web stack
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Linked Data

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: prescription of procedures or activities which is aimed at a specific result under appropriate conditions
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Method

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: collection of syntactic rules (grammar) and semantic specifications for representing objects of a particular domain
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Modeling Language

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: result of a process of manipulation of natural language objects
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: NLP Artifact

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: semantic network of different configuration stages; up to formally specified conceptualizations of a domain
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Ontology

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: basic precepts in a particular field of action
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Policy

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: characteristics or features of an object required by potential users
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Requirements

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: specific reference or prescription for actions in a particular field of action
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Standard, Guideline

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: complex object whose parts interact and form a desing-related and functional whole
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: System

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Unambiguously described or explained technical or business term
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Term Definition

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: clearly specified sequence of activities to achieve a desired target state
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Workflow

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Solving a practice problem by a mixed group of scientists and practical experts. Several cycles of analysis, action and evaluation steps, each with a low level of structured instruments such as group discussions or planning games, are conducted.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Action Research (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Pure-language logical-deductive inferencing (as, for example, in philosophy)
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Argumentative Deductive Analysis (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The case study usually examines complex, difficult-to-distinguish phenomena in their natural context. It represents a special form of the qualitative-empirical methodology, which is investigated intensively by a few feature-bearers. It is either the objective examination of theses (behavioral approach) or the interpretation of behavioral patterns as the phenotypes of the realities constructed by the subjects (construction-oriented access).
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Case Study (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Logic-deductive inferencing using semiformal models
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Conceptual Deductive Analysis (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Design Science is an outcome-based information technology research methodology, which offers specific guidelines for evaluation and iteration within research projects.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Design Science (Hevner)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Ethnography would like to generate insights through participatory observation. The difference to the case study lies in the very high extent in which the researcher is integrated into the investigated social environment. There is a very small objective distance.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Ethnography (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The field experiment investigates causal relationships in a controlled environment by manipulating an experimental variable in a repeatable manner and measuring the effect of manipulation. The object to be investigated is examined in its natural environment (in the 'field'), whereby the possibilities of environmental control are significantly influenced.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Field Experiment (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Logic-deductive inferencing using mathematical-formal models
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Formal Deductive Analysis (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The Grounded Theory aims at the inductive acquisition of new theories by intensive observation of the object of investigation in the field. The various procedures for coding and evaluating the predominantly qualitative data are precisely specified.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Grounded Theory (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The laboratory experiment investigates causal relationships in a controlled environment by manipulating an experimental variable in a repetitive manner and measuring the effect of manipulation. The object to be investigated is examined in an artificial environment (in the 'laboratory'), whereby the possibilities of environmental control are significantly influenced.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Laboratory Experiment (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A literature review is a written document that presents a logically argued case founded on a comprehensive understanding of the current state of knowledge about a topic of study. This case establishes a convincing thesis to answer the studyâs question.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Literature Analysis (Machi/McEvoy)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A preliminary version of an application system is developed and evaluated. Both steps can generate new insights.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Prototyping (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: This method integrates survey techniques such as questionnaires, interviews, Delphi method, content analyzes, etc. into an aggregate. It comprises a one-time survey over several individuals, which is subsequently coded and evaluated qualitatively. The result is a cross-section profile characteristic for the sample participants, which usually allows conclusions to be drawn on the total population.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Qualitative Research (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: This method integrates survey techniques such as questionnaires, interviews, Delphi method, content analyzes, etc. into an aggregate. It comprises a one-time survey over several individuals, which is subsequently coded and evaluated quantatively. The result is a cross-section profile characteristic for the sample participants, which usually allows conclusions to be drawn on the total population.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Quantitative Research (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The reference modeling produces inductively (out of observations) or deductively (eg from theories or models) mostly simplified and optimized projections (ideal concepts) of systems, in order to deepen existing knowledge and generate design templates from this.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Reference Modeling (Wilde/Hess)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The simulation models the behavior of the system to be investigated formally and compares environmental conditions with certain assignments of the model parameters. Both the model construction and the observation of the endogenous model parameters allow to gain insights.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Simulation (Wilde/Hess)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The additional name for person, can be used for a middle name.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: additional name

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General datatype property, potentially usable for specifying alternative names of a resource.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: alternative name

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A secondary title of a scientific paper.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: alternative headline

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An award won by or for this scientific paper.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: award

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Is used to create references of a scientific paper to other items of creative work (particularly other papers).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: citation

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: date created

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was modified or the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: date modified

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General datatype property, potentially usable for description of all resources.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Email address of a person or an organization.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: email

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The end time of some event.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: end time

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The last name of a person.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: family name

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fax number of a person or an organization.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fax number

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The first name of a person.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: given name

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Headline or title of a scientific paper.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: headline

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An honorific prefix preceding a person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: honoric prefix

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An honorific suffix preceding a person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: honoric suffix

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General datatype property, potentially usable for relating an image of a resource.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: image

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an event.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: in language

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The job title of the person (for example, Knowledge Engineer).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: job title

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Keywords or tags used to describe the content of a creative work. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: keywords

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The legal name of an organization.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: legal name

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An associated logo of an organization.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: logo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General datatype property, potentially usable for specifying the name of a resource.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General datatype property, potentially usable for relating one resource to a URL representing the same resource.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: same as

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The start time of some event.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: start time

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Telephone number of a person or an organization.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: telephone

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The textual content of this creative work.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: text

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General datatype property, potentially usable for specifying the URL of a resource.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: url
